Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RI-18 (AN-1, RA-48 fragment, Lys-rich, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, reptiles, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature.Author: Wu Z, Cai Y, Han Y, Su Y, Zhang T, Wang X, Yan A, Wang L, Wu S, Wang G, Zhang Z. 2024
Literature.Title: Development of alpha-Helical Antimicrobial Peptides with Imperfect Amphipathicity for Superior Activity and Selectivity.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (60%) toRL-30K: 44%, I: 17%, V=R: 11%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC6538 and 7 clinical strains and 9 MRSA strains (MIC 2.34 ug/ml), A. baumannii ATCC19606 and 3 clinical strains (MIC 2.34-4.68 ug/ml), three E. coli clinical strains (MIC 9.37-18.75 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa 4 clinical strains (MIC 1.17-4.68 ug/ml).Inhibited bioffilm formation:bacteria:P. aeruginosa and disrupted biofilms by 60%; Inhibited biofilm formation:bacteria:A. baumannii and disrupted biofilms by 30% at 5x or 10x MIC; Inhibited biofilm formation:bacteria:S. aureus and disrupted biofilms by 60%. Kill persisters as well.In vitro toxicity: not hemo.lytic till 100 ug/ml.  Not toxic to HEK293 and HaCaT cells.Structure:  random coil in water and helical in SDS.In vivo toxicity: IV injection 10-20 mg/kg peptide showed no sign of toxicity in 48 h.
